title: Boeuf bourguignon with baguette dumplings
description: Each region in France uses their own local red wine for this dish, so you don’t need to use a bottle of Burgundy. Dumplings made from leftover baguettes make a great alternative to potatoes, as well as soaking up the juices from the stew.
ingredients: 900g/2lb beef shin or stewing beef, cut into 6 large chunks
150g/5½oz lardons or cubes of smoked bacon
200g/7oz stale baguette or other bread (crust included)
salt and freshly ground black pepper
